if (i == 0) {
playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1;
updateRequired = true;
return;
}
}

something like that i think
[/quote]

what the love dude, that’s loveing retarded[/quote]

it was an example lmao
I would of used an event

item.title: [PI]Timed item disappearing
item.dc:creator: @hotkid8200 hotkid8200
item.description:
@hotkid8200 wrote:

[quote=“Angel Carlos, post:7, topic:523293”]I really want to help, but i don’t even understand what’s your problem.

Is it, when players logout and login they can do it, and not saving???[/quote]

Ok this is the problem, when you wear the ring your delay is suppose to start at 7200, and that works, so every second it would go down by one 7199, 7198, 7197…a lot of seconds later 3600 it sends “30 minutes left” 3600 later it turns dringdelay time to = 0 and it deletes the ring, but the problem is that it isn’t decreasing! so if you have 7200 it never goes down to 7199, and so forth! That’s my problem the item should disappear after 1 hour or my selected time.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Timed item disappearing
item.dc:creator: @hotkid8200 hotkid8200
item.description:
@hotkid8200 wrote:

Arcik:

I don’t see deleteItem() in your code

Well it happens when you equip the item 2568, so the timer ticks when you’re wearing the item, but that is the problem it doesn’t work. It’s suppose to delete the ring when the timer hits dringdelay = 0. But the timer doesn’t even work. so if you’re at 7200 it never goes down to 7199.

it delete from the slot the item is on :
playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1;

item.title: [PI]Timed item disappearing
item.dc:creator: @hotkid8200 hotkid8200
item.description:
@hotkid8200 wrote:

Alright I’ve had so much trouble getting this to work, any reason why it’s not working?

this is all the code I have added to this timed item disappear!
In player.java
public void dRingDelay() { Client c = (Client)this; if(playerEquipment[playerRing] == 2568) { dRingDelay--; } if (dRingDelay == 3600) { c.sendMessage("You have 30 minutes left on your ring"); } if (dRingDelay == 0) { playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1; updateRequired = true; dRingDelay = 7200; } }

In player.java

in playersave.java

characterfile.write("Double = ", 0, 9); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.dRingDelay), 0, Integer.toString(p.dRingDelay).length()); characterfile.newLine();

That is everything I’ve done, can someone tell me why it isn’t working? What error is in the code that makes it do nothing? Thanks :D.

Edit: I’d also like to point out I’ve done this guide http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/377456-overloads-dc-server-fix.html sorry if I can’t link out rune-server. and it goes for the same as “overloadcounter–;” so you have to re log to pot, not wait 5 minutes as it should be 300. I only pointed it out because it’s a similar concept

Read full topic
